value.title: RSS to JSON pipe copy copy
value.description: Converts RSS to JSON, with user specified count and  RSS URL.

items.title: Mursi U-turn on Egypt prosecutor
items.description: President Mohammed Mursi of Egypt agrees to allow the Mubarak-era chief prosecutor to keep his job after an embarrassing public row.
items.y:title: Mursi U-turn on Egypt prosecutor

items.title: Pakistan market bomb 'kills 15'
items.description: At least 15 people are killed in a market bombing apparently aimed at an anti-Taliban group in north-west Pakistan, security officials say.
items.y:title: Pakistan market bomb 'kills 15'

items.title: Shuttle rolls into history in LA
items.description: Los Angeles residents turn out to watch the US space shuttle Endeavour as it inches through the city on a giant trolley, bound for a museum.
items.y:title: Shuttle rolls into history in LA

items.title: Auction sets living artist record
items.description: An oil painting by Gerhard Richter owned by Eric Clapton sells for £21m ($34m) - an auction record for a work by a living artist.
items.y:title: Auction sets living artist record

items.title: UN Syria envoy hold Turkey talks
items.description: The UN-Arab League envoy for Syria, Lakhdar Brahimi, holds talks in Turkey amid rising tensions between Ankara and Damascus.
items.y:title: UN Syria envoy hold Turkey talks

items.title: Kyrgyz ex-leader's son held in UK
items.description: Police in London arrest a son of fugitive former Kyrgyz President Kurmanbek Bakiyev following a US request to extradite him on fraud charges.
items.y:title: Kyrgyz ex-leader's son held in UK

items.title: Nine charged in France drug bust
items.description: Authorities in France and Switzerland arrest 20 people, including the deputy mayor of a Paris district, in a major drug money laundering operation,.
items.y:title: Nine charged in France drug bust

items.title: Savile's role at Broadmoor probed
items.description: The Department of Health is to investigate the decision to appoint Sir Jimmy Savile as head of a taskforce overseeing the high security psychiatric hospital Broadmoor in the late 1980s.
items.y:title: Savile's role at Broadmoor probed

items.title: Tibetan man 'sets himself alight'
items.description: An ethnic Tibetan man has died after setting himself on fire in protest against Chinese rule over Tibet, rights campaigners say.
items.y:title: Tibetan man 'sets himself alight'

items.title: Bomb targets Afghan intelligence
items.description: Several people are killed as a suicide attacker bombs an Afghan intelligence office in Kandahar province.
items.y:title: Bomb targets Afghan intelligence

items.title: Colombia indigenous given apology
items.description: Colombia's president apologises for the devastation of indigenous communities by the rush to exploit rubber in the Amazon 100 years ago.
items.y:title: Colombia indigenous given apology

items.title: VIDEO: UN envoy to hold talks in Turkey
items.description: The UN-Arab League envoy for Syria, Lakhdar Brahimi, is due to hold talks in Turkey, amid rising tensions between Ankara and Damascus.
items.y:title: VIDEO: UN envoy to hold talks in Turkey

items.title: VIDEO: World's oldest teacher almost 100
items.description: A man who is only a few weeks short of his 100th birthday has been officially recognised as the world's oldest full-time teacher.
items.y:title: VIDEO: World's oldest teacher almost 100

items.title: VIDEO: Five Minutes With: Pink
items.description: Pink speaks to Matthew Stadlen about her life philosophy, politics, fine wine - and how she uses her fame to get a table when she goes to a restaurant.
items.y:title: VIDEO: Five Minutes With: Pink

items.title: VIDEO: One-minute World News
items.description: Watch the latest news summary from BBC World News. International news updated 24 hours a day.
items.y:title: VIDEO: One-minute World News

items.title: VIDEO: South Asia's first 'Gay Games'
items.description: Being gay is still illegal in some south Asian countries, but that has not stopped hundreds of athletes taking part in the region's first gay, bisexual and transgender games.
items.y:title: VIDEO: South Asia's first 'Gay Games'

items.title: VIDEO: Final trip for shuttle Endeavour
items.description: The space shuttle Endeavour, which retired from service last year, has been making its very last journey - through the streets of Los Angeles at 2mph (3kph).
items.y:title: VIDEO: Final trip for shuttle Endeavour

items.title: VIDEO: Richard Ford: How to tease your reader
items.description: Richard Ford's new book Canada opens with a summary of what the book is about. Is he spoiling his own plot or is it a clever tease on the reader?
items.y:title: VIDEO: Richard Ford: How to tease your reader

items.title: VIDEO: How do you crack the Rubik's cube?
items.description: The European Rubik's Cube Championship and hundreds of competitors are taking part.
items.y:title: VIDEO: How do you crack the Rubik's cube?

items.title: JP Morgan predicts housing upturn
items.description: JP Morgan Chase boss Jamie Dimon cuts the amount set aside to cover mortgage losses and announces a 33% rise in three month profit.
items.y:title: JP Morgan predicts housing upturn

items.title: IMF backs more time for Greece
items.description: IMF chief Christine Lagarde backs calls for Greece to have more time to meet the targets of its bailout, but Germany's finance minister rebuffs the idea.
items.y:title: IMF backs more time for Greece

items.title: US readies cyber-attack forces
items.description: The US is preparing military forces skilled at conducting operations via computer networks to counter imminent cyber-attacks, says US secretary of defense.
items.y:title: US readies cyber-attack forces

items.title: Love letter recreator wins award
items.description: An art installation that helps an ageing computer write love letters has won an award for the best computer conservation project.
items.y:title: Love letter recreator wins award

items.title: Stars pay tribute at Whitney show
items.description: A host of celebrities pay tribute to Whitney Houston as part of a special Grammy television show.
items.y:title: Stars pay tribute at Whitney show

items.title: Weinstein attacks 'free internet'
items.description: US film producer Harvey Weinstein criticises media giants Apple and Google for making content available under the guise of "free internet".
items.y:title: Weinstein attacks 'free internet'

items.title: 'Europe's GPS' reaches key phase
items.description: Europe's own version of the US Global Positioning System reaches a key milestone with the launch of a second pair of satellites.
items.y:title: 'Europe's GPS' reaches key phase

items.title: Marine Protected Areas skyrocket
items.description: A biodiversity conference in India hears that rapid uptake of Marine Protected Areas has increased their total coverage 10-fold in the past decade.
items.y:title: Marine Protected Areas skyrocket

items.title: NHS and US 'should share ideas'
items.description: The US health system and the NHS have much to learn from each other - despite being thought of as polar opposites, experts say.
items.y:title: NHS and US 'should share ideas'

items.title: Baby boomer alcohol harm warning
items.description: More NHS money is spent treating alcohol-related illness in baby boomers than young people, a study says.
items.y:title: Baby boomer alcohol harm warning

items.title: Injured Walcott out of Poland tie
items.description: Theo Walcott returns to Arsenal after being ruled out of England's clash with Poland on Tuesday with a chest injury.
items.y:title: Injured Walcott out of Poland tie

items.title: Murray beats Federer in Shanghai
items.description: Andy Murray remains on course for his third successive Shanghai Masters title after beating Roger Federer in the semi-finals.
items.y:title: Murray beats Federer in Shanghai

items.title: Bill waived after 12qn-euro gaffe
items.description: A woman in south-west France, who mistakenly received a telephone bill of nearly 12 quadrillion euros, has the real amount she owed waived.
items.y:title: Bill waived after 12qn-euro gaffe

items.title: Mammoth carcass found in Siberia
items.description: A well-preserved mammoth carcass has been found by an 11-year-old boy in the permafrost of northern Siberia.
items.y:title: Mammoth carcass found in Siberia

items.title: UN adopts north Mali resolution
items.description: The UN Security Council adopts a resolution that moves a step closer to foreign military intervention against Islamist rebels in northern Mali.
items.y:title: UN adopts north Mali resolution

items.title: Bruyneel and White depart posts
items.description: Lance Armstrong's ex-team manager Johan Bruyneel leaves Radioshack while former team-mate Matt White departs GreenEdge.
items.y:title: Bruyneel and White depart posts

items.title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to EU
items.description: The EU wins the Nobel Peace Prize for six decades of advancement of peace, reconciliation, democracy and human rights in Europe.
items.y:title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to EU

items.title: Cuban refugees die near Mexico
items.description: A home-made raft carrying 23 Cuban refugees sinks as it hits reefs near the Mexican beach resort of Cancun.
items.y:title: Cuban refugees die near Mexico

items.title: New Jordanian government sworn in
items.description: Thousands of people begin gathering in Jordan's capital Amman amid a large police presence to call for faster political reforms.
items.y:title: New Jordanian government sworn in

items.title: Romney criticises Biden on Libya
items.description: Mitt Romney says Vice-President Joe Biden made misleading remarks in Thursday's debate about last month's Libya consulate attack.
items.y:title: Romney criticises Biden on Libya

items.title: RBS queries branch sale collapse
items.description: The chairman of the Royal Bank of Scotland challenges Santander's explanation for pulling out of a deal to buy 316 of its branches.
items.y:title: RBS queries branch sale collapse

items.title: Middlesbrough MP Stuart Bell dies
items.description: Senior Labour backbencher and Middlesbrough MP Sir Stuart Bell dies after a short battle with pancreatic cancer, his family says.
items.y:title: Middlesbrough MP Stuart Bell dies

items.title: Charges linked to RUC man murder
items.description: A man has been charged with offences linked to the murder of a police officer in Londonderry almost 20 years ago.
items.y:title: Charges linked to RUC man murder

items.title: Clean-up after severe rain hits
items.description: A clean-up operation is under way after severe rains brought flooding and travel disruption to parts of Scotland.
items.y:title: Clean-up after severe rain hits
